title: Get Available Methods
description: This method lists the methods available under /building/

Success 200.description: The name of the application that is accessing the API.
Tells the application if the request was successful.
The methods that are available

examples.title: Success Response:
Curl
examples.content: curl -H "X-Authorization: <Your-API-Key>" --url https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" }.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/ -Headers $headers

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.asString();

name: GetBuildingLimit

title: Post to Building
description: Using a Datatel code as part of the url parameter, an application can create new building record or update existing records. If the Datatel code in the URL does not exist in the database, the rest of the data sent in the POST request will be treated as a new entry. If the Datatel code in the URL does exist in the database, the data sent in the POST request will replace the data in that record.

Success 200.description: The name of the application that is accessing the API.
Tells the application if the request was successful.
The action that was performed. This may be update or create.

examples.title: Success Response:
Curl
examples.content:
curl -H "X-Authorization: <Your-API-Key>" \
--data "name=Ackerman" \
--url https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/code/:code

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/code/:code",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" },
parameters:{ :name => "Ackerman"}.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$uri = https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/code/:code
$body = @{ email2 = "Ackerman" }
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Post -Body $body

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building/code/:code")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.body("{\"name\":\"Ackerman\"}")
.asString();

examples.title: Python
.NET

Error 4xx.description: The name of the application that is accessing the API.
Tells the application if the request was successful.
The application does not have write access to the API.
The application did not provide the required data.
User attributes and a boolean value that signifies if they are required or not.
The application does have write access, but the commit failed. This is due to an error on the server.

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
     "application": "Awesome Application",
     "success": true,
     "result": {
         "id": "1",
         "sageid": "999998",
         "username": "buildb3",
         "name_first": "Bob",
         "name_middle": "T.",
         "name_last": "Builder",
         "email": "buildb3@sage.edu",
         "email2": "bob@gmail.com",
         "dorm": "5",
         "role": "1",
         "active": "1",
         "phone": "5182444777",
         "room": "302",
         "has_photo_id": "1",
         "photo_id_url": "http://idmanager.sage.edu/pics/accepted/0999998.jpg",
         "photo_id_filename": "999998.jpg"
      }
}

title: Get X Amount of Records

examples.title: Error Response:

name: GetUserUsernameUsername

title: Post to User
description: Using a Sage ID number as part of the url parameter, an application can create new user records or update existing records. If the Sage ID in the URL does not exist in the database, the rest of the data sent in the POST request will be treated as a new user entry. If the Sage ID in the URL does exist in the database, the data sent in the POST request will replace the data in that users record.

Success 200.description: The name of the application that is accessing the API.
Tells the application if the request was successful.
The action that was performed. This may be update or create.

examples.title: Success Response:
Curl
examples.content:
curl -H "X-Authorization: <Your-API-Key>" \
--data "email2=lukeskywalker@gmail.com&username=skywal" \
--url https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/user/sageid/:sageid

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/user/sageid/:sageid",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" },
parameters:{ :email2 => "lukeskywalker@gmail.com", :username => "skywal" }.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$uri = https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/user/sageid/:sageid
$body = @{ email2 = "lukeskywalker@gmail.com", username = "skywal" }
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Post -Body $body

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/user/sageid/:sageid")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.body("{\"email2\":\"lukeskywalker@gmail.com\", \"username\":\"skywal\"}")
.asString();

examples.title: Python
.NET
examples.content:
// This code snippet uses an open-source library http://unirest.io/net
 Task<HttpResponse<MyClass>> response = Unirest.post("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/user/sageid/:sageid")
 .header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
 .header("Accept", "application/json")
 .field("email2", "lukeskywalker@gmail.com")
 .field("username", "skywal")
 .asString();

Error 4xx.description: The name of the application that is accessing the API.
Tells the application if the request was successful.
The application does not have write access to the API.
The application did not provide the required data.
User attributes and a boolean value that signifies if they are required or not.
The application does have write access, but the commit failed. This is due to an error on the server.

HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
{
    "application": "Awesome Application",
    "success": false,
    "error": "InsufficientPostData",
    "required": {
        "sageid": true,
        "username": true,
        "name_first": true,
        "name_middle": false,
        "name_last": true,
        "email": true,
        "email2": false,
        "dorm": false,
        "role": true,
        "active": true,
        "phone": false,
        "room": false
    }
}
